summary.para: Creates a font family object, given a zero-based font family index.

param.name: index
param.para: Zero-based index of the font family.

param.name: fontFamily
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font family object.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Retrieves the font family model used by the font collection to group families.

returns.para: How families are grouped in the collection.

summary.para: Retrieves the underlying font set used by this collection.

param.name: fontSet
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to the font set used by the collection.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Retrieves a list of fonts in the specified font family, ranked in order of how well they match the specified axis values.

param.name: familyName
param.para: Name of the font family. The name is not case-sensitive, but must otherwise exactly match a family name in the collection.

param.name: fontAxisValues
param.para: A pointer to an array containing a list of font axis values. The array should be the size (the number of elements) indicated by the fontAxisValueCount argument.

param.name: fontAxisValueCount
param.para: The number of font axis values contained in the fontAxisValues array.

param.name: fontList
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font list object.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

remarks.para: If no fonts match, an empty list object is returned (calling on it returns 0), but the function doesn't return an error.

summary.para: This interface encapsulates a set of fonts, such as the set of fonts installed on the system, or the set of fonts in a particular directory. The font collection API can be used to discover what font families and fonts are available, and to obtain some metadata about the fonts. IDWriteFontCollection2 adds new facilities, including support for .
